meanings.sent1: The artist used a counterimage to show the opposite of what was expected.
meanings.sent2: The black and white photo was a counterimage of the colorful painting.
meanings.sent3: The counterimage of a sunny day was a stormy night in the painting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a counterimage to the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflection provided a clear counterimage of the room.

meanings.definition: To create a contrasting or opposing image
meanings.sent1: She decided to counterimage the bright scene with a dark filter.
meanings.sent2: The photographer counterimaged the peaceful landscape with a chaotic cityscape.
meanings.sent3: He playfully counterimaged his friend's serious pose with a silly face.
meanings.sent4: The artist counterimaged reality with a dreamlike interpretation.
meanings.sent5: The designer counterimaged traditional patterns with modern colors.

meanings.definition: A representation that opposes or contradicts another image
meanings.sent1: The political cartoon served as a counterimage to the official statement.
meanings.sent2: The sculpture was a powerful counterimage to the peaceful garden setting.
meanings.sent3: The counterimage of the superhero was a clumsy sidekick in the comic.
meanings.sent4: Her confident walk was a counterimage to her shy demeanor in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The protest sign was a bold counterimage to the quiet street scene.
